Chromaffin cell.Definition: A cell located primarily in the adrenal medulla and paraganglia of the sympathetic nervous system that stores epinephrine secretory vesicles. Their name derives from their ability to stain a brownish color with chromic salts. , A cell located primarily in the adrenal medulla and paraganglia of the sympathetic nervous system that stores epinephrine secretory vesicles.
